A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
This was the kick in the hyperdrive motivator the franchise needed. Congratulations to Rian Johnson for having the fortitude to take Star Wars in new directions\, instead of rehashing the same old stories about the same old characters.
The anger and backlash at this film is misplaced and silly.
Luke was always whiny. Becoming a Jedi master did not change his nature. We know as much about Snoke as we knew about the Emperor through the first trilogy.
And the best thing about Last Jedi is that it dares to deliver something no other Star Wars film could handle: Moral ambiguity. Gone are the simplistic days of easy to spot good guys vs. bad guys. Johnson has introduced shades of gray and\, in doing so\, made the future of Star Wars more interesting.
